coredata.dc:title: Improved binding site assignment by high-resolution mapping of RNA-protein interactions using iCLIP

abstract.publishercopyright: © 2015 Macmillan Publishers Limited. All rights reserved.
abstract.ce:para: Individual-nucleotide resolution crosslinking and immunoprecipitation (iCLIP) allows the determination of crosslinking sites of RNA-binding proteins (RBPs) on RNAs. iCLIP is based on ultraviolet light crosslinking of RBPs to RNA, reverse transcription and high-throughput sequencing of fragments terminating at the site of crosslinking. As a result, start sites of iCLIP fragments are expected to cluster with a narrow distribution, typically representing the site of direct interaction between the RBP and the RNA. Here we show that for several RBPs (eIF4A3, PTB, SRSF3, SRSF4 and hnRNP L), the start sites of iCLIP fragments show a fragment length-dependent broader distribution that can be shifted to positions upstream of the known RNA-binding site. We developed an analysis tool that identifies these shifts and can improve the positioning of RBP binding sites.

xocs:funding.xocs:funding-agency: Javna Agencija za Raziskovalno Dejavnost RS

xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: We thank the EMBL Genomics Core Facility for high-throughput sequencing, and especially V. Benes for advice in library preparation. We thank C. Girardot and S. Su from the Genome Biology Computational Support (GBCS) group for assistance with the Galaxy environment, N. Haberman for bioinformatic advice, C. Sibley and J. König for sharing their pre-publication iCLIP data, and K. Zarnack for her comments on the manuscript. We thank J. Ule for insightful discussions. S.A. and W.H. acknowledge funding from the European Union’s Seventh Framework Programme (Project Radiant, grant agreement 305626). T.C. acknowledges support by the Slovenian Research Agency (J7-5460). M.W.H and A.E.K acknowledge support by the Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft (DFG) in the context of the program grants FOR 855 and SFB 1036.

item-info.copyright: Copyright 2015 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

University of Ljubljana, Faculty of Computer and Information Science

abstract.publishercopyright: © 2015 Macmillan Publishers Limited. All rights reserved.
abstract.ce:para: Individual-nucleotide resolution crosslinking and immunoprecipitation (iCLIP) allows the determination of crosslinking sites of RNA-binding proteins (RBPs) on RNAs. iCLIP is based on ultraviolet light crosslinking of RBPs to RNA, reverse transcription and high-throughput sequencing of fragments terminating at the site of crosslinking. As a result, start sites of iCLIP fragments are expected to cluster with a narrow distribution, typically representing the site of direct interaction between the RBP and the RNA. Here we show that for several RBPs (eIF4A3, PTB, SRSF3, SRSF4 and hnRNP L), the start sites of iCLIP fragments show a fragment length-dependent broader distribution that can be shifted to positions upstream of the known RNA-binding site. We developed an analysis tool that identifies these shifts and can improve the positioning of RBP binding sites.
